newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Cyrix up, Intel off.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Cyrix up, Intel off.

text.p: Cyrix Corp shares climbed ahead of Thursday's U.S. market open on positive expectations for the company's new computer chip designed for use in reduced-cost personal computers.
Before the opening bell, Cyrix stock added 1-1/4 to 26-3/4, while Intel -- a direct competitor of Cyrix's -- fell to 151-1/2 from 153-7/8, traders said.
"Cyrix is looking higher on news of its new chip, and based on that same news, Intel is trading lower," a trader said.
Cyrix said Compaq Computer Corp is the first manufacturer to use the microprocessor, named MediaGX. Compaq unveiled on Thursday a new line of machines priced at less than $1000.
Compaq shares made no moves early Thursday, traders said.
Informix Corp suffered after Smith Barney downgraded the stock, the shares slippping one to 17-5/8.
Another early decliner was Hutchinson Technology Inc, traders said.
The shares were trading at 36-1/2, off 3/4, after the company said last night it set a secondary offering of 3.4 million common shares at $36 each.
Among other stocks busy before the bell were Microsoft, off 1/2 to 97 and Medicis Pharmaceutical jumped to 59-7/8 from 56-13/16.
